head.title: Police Say Mother Kidnapped Her Baby

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Police Say Mother Kidnapped Her Baby

abstract.p: Carol Codrington, woman who had lost custody of her newborn daughter because infant had tested positive for cocaine, kidnaps week-old girl from Manhattan hospital (S)

block.p: A woman who had lost custody of her newborn daughter because the infant had tested positive for cocaine kidnapped the week-old girl from a Manhattan hospital yesterday, the authorities said.
The police were searching last night for the baby and the woman, Carol Codrington, 29, of Tillitson Avenue in the Bronx, said Officer Gary Cillo, a department spokesman.
A woman who had lost custody of her newborn daughter because the infant had tested positive for cocaine kidnapped the week-old girl from a Manhattan hospital yesterday, the authorities said.
The police were searching last night for the baby and the woman, Carol Codrington, 29, of Tillitson Avenue in the Bronx, said Officer Gary Cillo, a department spokesman.
Ms. Codrington had permission to visit and feed the infant at St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center, but was not allowed to take the girl out of the hospital, an investigator said.
At 4:10 p.m. yesterday, however, Ms. Codrington walked out the door with the girl, who was born July 24, Officer Cillo said.
The hospital would not say what security measures it had taken to keep the baby from being taken.
''We are working with the local police in their investigation of this matter, and until further notice we have no further comment,'' said Andrew Miller, a spokesman for the hospital.

Ms. Codrington has at least two other children that have been taken from her and put in foster care, said a spokeswoman for the Administration for Children's Services, Jennifer Falk, but she had no details.
